description: From earlier garlick, garlicke, from Middle English garlek, garlik, from Old English gārlēac (“garlic”, literally “spear-leek”), from gār ("spear"; in reference to its sharp, tapering leaves) + lēac (“leek”). Cognate with Scots garlic (“garlic”), Faroese geirleykur (“garlic”), Icelandic geirlaukur (“garlic”).

entries.meaning: A plant, Allium sativum, related to the onion, having a pungent bulb much used in cooking.
(uncountable) A preparation from Allium sativum used as a food ingredient or the flavor or other characteristics of such an ingredient.

verbs.description: garlic (third-person singular simple present garlics, present participle garlicking, simple past and past participle garlicked)
